2. Lin and Clare each wrote equations to show their thinking.

Explain how you know which group of equations matches Lin’s work and which matches Clare’s work.

A

  • 71 - 50 = 21
  • 21 = 10 + 11
  • 11 - 6 = 5
  • 10 + 5 = 15

B

  • 71 = 60 + 11
  • 11 - 6 = 5
  • 60 - 50 = 10
  • 10 + 5 = 15

Explain your reasoning:

3. How are Lin and Clare’s methods the same? How are they different?
